item.title: 奇货可居：石油公司面临的双重打击（播客）
item.description: 与上届政府相比，新一届政府提出了 "钻井，宝贝，钻井 "的口号，并对石油和天然气行业采取了更加自由的态度。但这并没有为石油工业本身带来丰厚的利润。原油价格下跌，关税提高了试图从地下获取能源的公司的组件成本。那么，该行业的未来会怎样？现在究竟谁在赚钱？在本期节目中，我们将与能源行业的资深人士彼得-特尔扎基（Peter Tertzaki）进行对话。【原文：The new administration has a “drill, baby, drill” mantra and a much more liberal attitude towards the oil and gas industry than the last one. But that hasn’t translated into great profits for the oil industry itself. Crude prices have sunk and tariffs have raised the cost of components for companies trying to get energy out of the ground. So, what’s the future for the industry? And who is actually making money right now? In this episode, we talk to longtime energy industry veteran Peter Tertzaki】

item.title: 特朗普希望苹果公司停止将 iPhone 生产转移到印度
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，他已要求苹果公司的蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）停止在印度建厂，矛头直指这家 iPhone 制造商在中国之外实现生产多样化的计划。【原文：US President Donald Trump said he’s asked Apple Inc.’s Tim Cook to stop building plants in India, taking aim at the iPhone maker’s plans to diversify its manufacturing beyond China.】

item.title: 南非土地银行正在洽谈融资，金额高达 10 亿美元
item.description: 南非一家为农民提供融资的国有银行正在与出资人谈判，希望从五年前的违约事件中恢复过来，筹集多达 10 亿美元的资金。【原文：A state-owned South African bank that finances farmers is in talks with funders to raise as much as $1 billion as it recovers from a default five years ago.】

item.title: 埃尼公司同意与阿瑞斯公司就出售 Plenitude 股份进行独家谈判
item.description: 埃尼公司（Eni SpA）同意与 Ares Alternative Credit Management 公司就 Plenitude 公司 20% 的股份进行独家谈判，这将是该公司可再生能源部门的第二次股权出售。【原文：Eni SpA agreed to exclusive talks with Ares Alternative Credit Management for a 20% holding in Plenitude, in what would be the second stake sale in its renewables unit.】

item.title: 特朗普冲击市场，亚洲保险公司面临数十亿美元损失
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的政策引发了市场动荡，日本和台湾的人寿保险公司正面临着数十亿美元的纸面损失。【原文：Life insurers in Japan and Taiwan are staring down billions of dollars in paper losses from market turmoil triggered by reactions to Donald Trump’s policies.】

item.title: 在特朗普征收关税之前，瑞士国内生产总值创两年来最大增幅
item.description: 2025 年初，瑞士实现了两年来最强劲的增长势头，在美国关税的预期打击之前出人意料地加速增长。【原文：Switzerland enjoyed its strongest growth spurt in two years at the start of 2025, unexpectedly accelerating before an anticipated hit from US tariffs.】

item.title: 国家电网认为希思罗机场和地铁停运是孤立事件
item.description: 英国国家电网公司首席执行官约翰-佩蒂格鲁（John Pettigrew）表示，希思罗机场和伦敦地铁最近发生的停电事故并不表明英国电网的可靠性下降。【原文：Recent power outages at Heathrow airport and on the London Underground are not indications of a drop in the UK electricity network’s reliability, National Grid Plc Chief Executive Officer John Pettigrew said.】

item.title: 中美贸易谈判代表在韩国举行会谈
item.description: 中美两国官员周四在韩国举行了贸易谈判，而就在几天前，双方在瑞士举行了会晤，并同意暂停部分关税 90 天。【原文：US and Chinese officials met for trade talks in South Korea on Thursday, just days after both sides met in Switzerland and agreed to pause some tariffs for 90 days.】

item.title: 挪威经济反弹创近三年最大增幅
item.description: 挪威第一季度的经济增长出乎意料地好于预期，增速为近三年来最快，证明了挪威央行对宽松政策的谨慎立场。【原文：Norway’s economy surprised with better-than-expected growth in the first quarter, expanding at the fastest pace in almost three years, vindicating the central bank’s cautious stance on easing.】

item.title: Greencore 同意以 12 亿英镑收购食品制造商 Bakkavor
item.description: 方便食品制造商格林科尔集团（Greencore Group Plc）同意以约 12 亿英镑（16 亿美元）的价格收购竞争对手 Bakkavor Group Plc。【原文：Convenience food manufacturer Greencore Group Plc agreed to buy rival Bakkavor Group Plc for about £1.2 billion ($1.6 billion).】

item.title: Aviva财富部门资产增长5%，资金流入23亿英镑
item.description: 英国英杰华保险公司（Aviva Plc）称，其财富管理部门在第一季度出现资金净流入，管理资产增长了 5%。【原文：UK insurer Aviva Plc said its wealth unit saw net inflows in the first quarter, with assets under management in the business rising by 5%.】

item.description: 在加税和唐纳德-特朗普贸易战的双重打击下，英国经济实现了一年来最强劲的季度增长。【原文：The UK economy enjoyed its strongest quarterly growth in a year before the double blow of tax hikes and Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 关税下调后，Shein 降价吸引美国消费者回流
item.description: 在特朗普政府暂时下调中国进口商品关税后，申银万国集团有限公司本周下调了美国零售价，这家在线时尚零售商正努力挽回被近期关税引发的价格上涨吓跑的消费者。【原文：Shein Group Ltd. lowered US retail prices this week after the Trump administration temporarily cut duties on Chinese imports, as the online fashion retailer moves to win back consumers scared away by recent tariff-induced price hikes.】

item.description: 尽管汽车和工业客户需求疲软导致盈利下滑，蒂森克虏伯股份公司仍重申了全年指导目标。【原文：Thyssenkrupp AG reaffirmed its full-year guidance even as earnings slumped due to weak demand from automotive and industrial customers.】

item.title: 西门子中国工厂自动化业务回暖，收入增加
item.description: 受中国工厂自动化销售复苏以及美国和欧洲火车订单增加的推动，西门子股份公司今年前三个月的收入有所增长。【原文：Siemens AG’s revenues rose in the first three months of the year, driven by a recovery in factory-automation sales in China and larger orders for trains in the US and Europe.】

item.title: 德国电信因德国销售强劲上调盈利预期
item.description: 德国电信公司（Deutsche Telekom AG）上调了今年的盈利预期，此前该公司的季度利润高于预期，主要得益于其德国本土市场移动用户的增长。【原文：Deutsche Telekom AG raised its earnings forecast for the year after quarterly profit topped estimates, helped by mobile subscriber gains in its home market of Germany.】

item.title: 新加坡邮政认为贸易困境给物流业带来长期挑战
item.description: 新加坡邮政有限公司预计，持续的挑战将延续到下一个财政年度，持续的贸易紧张局势预计将对跨境物流量造成压力。【原文：Singapore Post Ltd. expects persistent challenges to continue into the next financial year, with ongoing trade tensions predicted to pressure cross-border logistics volumes.】

item.title: 需求减弱，新加坡房屋销售连续第二个月下滑
item.description: 新加坡私人住宅销售连续第二个月下降，原因是贸易紧张局势加剧了人们对经济前景的不安，导致对新项目的需求减少。【原文：Singapore private home sales fell for a second month as demand for new projects dimmed at a time when trade tensions are fueling unease about the economic outlook.】

item.title: 与中国达成 "关键性 "贸易停战后，富达增持美股
item.description: 富达国际（Fidelity International）的一位基金经理表示，她本周增加了对美股的投资，原因是在与中国达成贸易休战协议后，市场重现乐观情绪。【原文：A Fidelity International fund manager said she has increased exposure to US stocks this week, citing renewed optimism following the trade truce with China.】

item.description: 曼哈顿的公寓市场正进入一年中竞争最激烈的几个月，租金已经创下历史新高。在整个夏季，租金还会继续上涨。【原文：Manhattan’s apartment market is heading into its most competitive months of the year with rents already at record highs. They’re only likely to continue rising through the summer.】

item.title: 乌干达银行购买 15 亿美元，利用外汇掉期增加储备
item.description: 本财政年度，乌干达银行从市场上购买了 15 亿美元，并在外汇储备因援助冻结和债务偿还而消耗殆尽后，利用货币互换来重建外汇储备。【原文：The Bank of Uganda has bought $1.5 billion from the market this fiscal year and used currency swaps to rebuild its foreign-exchange reserves after they were drained by an aid freeze and debt repayments.】

item.title: 中美贸易冲突有可能使欧洲成为廉价商品的倾销地
item.description: 中国对欧盟的贸易顺差不断扩大，加剧了新的担忧，即在华盛顿和中国政府之间动荡的关税对抗中，这个由 27 个国家组成的集团有可能成为廉价商品的倾销地。【原文：China’s widening trade surplus with the European Union is fueling fresh concerns that the 27-nation bloc risks becoming a dumping ground for cheap goods in the volatile tariff confrontation between Washington and Beijing.】

item.title: 美国优先政策促使非洲初创企业寻求新的支持者
item.description: Oko Finance 是摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）支持的一家为非洲农民提供灾害保险的初创公司，该公司原本有望在今年实现盈利，直到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）削减资金，使其最大的客户流失。【原文：Oko Finance, a Morgan Stanley-backed startup providing disaster insurance to farmers in Africa, was on track to become profitable this year — until US President Donald Trump’s funding cuts gutted its biggest customer.】
